script-name: Script name. Translate if you have a well-sounding name.
script-name-short: Script name abbreviation. You can save the English version or translate this message according to the name in {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-script-name}}.
cm-gotoparent: Label of the comment menu item that sends the user to the parent comment.
cm-gotochild: Label of the comment menu item that sends the user to the child comment.
cm-copylink: Label of the comment menu item that copies a link to the comment.
cm-thank: Label of the comment menu item that thanks for to the comment.
cm-edit: Label of the comment menu item that opens an edit form the comment.
cm-reply: Label of the comment menu item that opens a reply form for the comment.
section-reply: Label of the button in the end of sections. It opens a reply form.
section-addsubsection-to:
Label of the button in the end of sections. It opens an "Add subsection" form.
$1: the section name.
section-newcomments: Label of the button that appears when there are new comments in the section.
cld-diff: Label of the text input in the copy link dialog.
cld-diff-error: Content of the text input in the copy link dialog. It is used when the edit wasn't found. The input is disabled in such cases.
cld-diff-error-network: Content of the text input in the copy link dialog. It is used when the edit link wasn't found. The input is disabled in such cases.
cld-diff-error-unknown: Content of the text input in the copy link dialog. It is used when the edit link wasn't found. The input is disabled in such cases.
cld-wikilink:
Label of the text input in the copy link dialog.

{{identical|Wikilink}}
cld-wikilink-help-comment: Help text for the text input labeled by {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cld-wikilink}} in the copy link dialog.
cld-currentpagewikilink: Label of the text input in the copy link dialog.
cld-link: In other words, a URL (not a wikilink).
cld-copy:
Label of the buttons in the copy link dialog.

{{identical|Copy}}
copylink-copied:
Text of the notification that appears when a wikilink was copied to the clipboard.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-copylink-copied-url}}
copylink-copied-url:
Text of the notification that appears when a URL was copied to the clipboard.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-copylink-copied}}
copylink-error: Text of the error notification that appears when the script wasn't able to copy a link.
copylink-error-diffnotfound:
Text of the error notification that appears when the user is trying to copy a link to the diff but the script wasn't able to find the edit that added the comment.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-thank-error-diffnotfound}}
copylink-error-diffnotfound-network: Text of the error notification that appears when the user is trying to copy a link to the diff.
copylink-error-diffnotfound-unknown: Text of the error notification that appears when the user is trying to copy a link to the diff.
thank-confirm: Text of the confirmation that pops up when the user tries to thank another user for the edit. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}). * $3: the edit's URL.
thank-error: Text of the error notification that appears when the script wasn't able to send the "thank you" notification.
thank-error-multipletimestamps: Text of the alert that appears when the script doesn't want to decide for the user whether the edit that it has found is appropriate to thank for it.
thank-error-diffnotfound:
Text of the error notification that appears when the user is trying to thank another user for a comment.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-copylink-error-diffnotfound}}
thank-error-network: Text of the error notification that appears when the script wasn't able to send the "thank you" notification.
thank-success: Text of the notification about a successfully sent "thank you" notification.
sm-editopeningcomment: Label of the section menu item that opens the opening comment of the section for editing.
sm-editopeningcomment-tooltip: Text of the tooltop for the section menu item labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sm-editopeningcomment}} message.
sm-addsubsection: Label of the section menu item that opens an "Add subsection" form.
sm-addsubsection-tooltip: Text of the tooltop for the section menu item labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sm-addsubsection}} message.
sm-move:
Label of the section menu item that opens a move section dialog.

{{identical|Move}}
sm-move-tooltip: Text of the tooltop for the section menu item labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sm-move}} message.
sm-watch:
Label of the section menu item that adds the section to the in-script watchlist.

{{identical|Watch}}
sm-watch-tooltip: Text of the tooltop for the section menu item labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sm-watch}} message.
sm-unwatch:
Label of the section menu item that removes the section from the in-script watchlist.

{{identical|Unwatch}}
sm-unwatch-tooltip: Text of the tooltop for the section menu item labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sm-unwatch}} message.
sm-copylink:
{{optional}}

Label of the section menu item that copies a link or opens a copy link dialog.
section-watch-success:
Text of the notification that appears when adding a section to the in-script watchlist.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-section-unwatch-stillwatched}}
section-unwatch-success: Text of the notification that appears when removing a section from the in-script watchlist.
section-unwatch-stillwatched: Text added to the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-section-unwatch-success}} notification in some cases.
section-watch-pagenotwatched: Text added to the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-section-watch-success}} notification in some cases.
section-watch-error-load: Text of the error notification that appears when adding or removing a section from the in-script watchlist.
section-watch-error-save: Text of the error notification that appears when adding or removing a section from the in-script watchlist.
section-watch-error-maxsize: Text of the error notification that appears when adding a section to the in-script watchlist.
es-reply: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you post your reply to openning comment.
es-reply-to: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you reply to another user. Use [[mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Magic_words#Localization|{{#gender:}}]] if you want to add 'user' word before nickname, leave empty if the word is not needed. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}).
es-addition: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you reply to yourself.
es-edit-reply: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit your reply.
es-edit-reply-to: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit your reply. Use [[mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Magic_words#Localization|{{#gender:}}]] if you want to add 'user' word before nickname, leave empty if the word is not needed. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}).
es-edit-addition: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit the addition.
es-edit-topic: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit the topic's opening comment.
es-edit-subsection: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit the subsection's opening comment.
es-edit-comment: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit your reply to 'opening comment'.
es-edit-comment-by: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit the comment by another user. Use [[mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Magic_words#Localization|{{#gender:}}]] if you want to add 'user' word before nickname, leave empty if the word is not needed. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}).
es-delete-reply: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you delete your reply.
es-delete-reply-to: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you edit your reply. Use [[mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Magic_words#Localization|{{#gender:}}]] if you want to add 'user' word before nickname, leave empty if the word is not needed. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}).
es-delete-addition: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you delete the addition.
es-delete-topic: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you delete the topic.
es-delete-subsection: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you delete the subsection.
es-delete-comment: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you delete the comment.
es-delete-comment-by: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you delete the comment by another user. Use [[mw:Special:MyLanguage/Help:Magic_words#Localization|{{#gender:}}]] if you want to add 'user' word before nickname, leave empty if the word is not needed. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}).
es-new-topic: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you create a new topic.
es-new-subsection: The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you create a new subsection.
es-move-from:
The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you move topic from one page to anothe.  

* $1: source page name.
es-move-to:
The message is inserted into the 'edit summary' field when you move topic from one page to anothe.  

* $1: landing page name.
cf-headline:
Name of the headline input in the comment form when adding a section or editing its opening comment. May be the same as {{msg-mw|subject}}.

This message is displayed in the "rescue comment forms" dialog when outputting the content of the comment forms that have no target comments or sections anymore.
cf-headline-topic: Placeholder of the headline input in the comment form when adding a topic or editing its opening comment.
cf-headline-subsection:
Placeholder of the headline input in the comment form when adding or editing a subsection.

$1: the section name.
cf-comment-placeholder-replytosection:
A placeholder of the comment input when replying to a section (topic).

$1: the section name.
cf-comment-placeholder-replytocomment:
A placeholder of the comment input when replying to a comment.

$1: the user name (sometimes with the word "user").
cf-comment-placeholder-addsection: Placeholder of the comment input in the comment form when adding or editing a section.
cf-comment-placeholder-addsubsection: Placeholder of the comment input in the comment form when adding or editing a subsection.
cf-summary-placeholder:
Placeholder of the summary input in the comment form.

{{Identical|Edit summary}}
cf-summary-preview: Label of the edit summary preview in the comment form.
cf-save-short:
Label of the "Save" button in the comment form when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-save}} message if possible.
{{identical|Save}}
cf-delete-button-short: Label of the "Delete" button in the comment form when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-delete}} message if possible.
cf-addtopic:
Label of the submit button in the comment form when adding a topic.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-addtopic-short}}
cf-addtopic-short: Label of the "Add topic" button in the comment form when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-addtopic}} message if possible.
cf-addsubsection:
Label of the submit button in the comment form when adding a subsection.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-addsubsection-short}}
cf-addsubsection-short: Label of the "Add subsection" button in the comment form when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-addsubsection}} message if possible.
cf-reply:
Label of the submit button in the comment form when adding a reply.

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-reply-short}}
cf-reply-short: Label of the "Reply" button in the comment form when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-reply}} message if possible.
cf-preview:
Label of the preview button in the comment form. A verb or verb phrase (compare to {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-block-preview}}).

See also: {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-preview-short}}
cf-preview-short: Label of the "Preview" button when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-preview}} message if possible.
cf-viewchanges: A verb or verb phrase. Compare to {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-block-viewchanges}}.
cf-viewchanges-short: Label of the "View changes" button when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-viewchanges}} message if possible.
cf-cancel-short:
Label of the "Cancel" button when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-cancel}} message if possible.
{{identical|Cancel}}
cf-settings:
Label of the button in the comment form that expands/collapses the settings block.

{{identical|Settings}}
cf-help-short:
{{optional}}

Label of the help button when there is too little horizontal space. It should be a short version (for example, one word instead of two) of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-help}} message if possible.
cf-help-content: Content of the help popup opened by the button labeled {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-help}} in the comment form.
cf-error-tryagain: Label of the button when an error has happened when opening a comment form.
cf-error-cancel: Label of the button when an error has happened when opening a comment form.
cf-quote-tooltip: Tooltip of the quote toolbar button in the comment form.
cf-quote-placeholder: This text appears in the comment input when clicking the quote toolbar button. It is meant to be a placeholder replaced by the text the user inputs.
cf-minor: Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to mark the edit as minor.
cf-watch: Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to watch the page.
cf-watchsection-topic: Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to watch the topic.
cf-watchsection-subsection: Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to watch the subsection.
cf-watchsection-tooltip: Text of the tooltip for the checkbox labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-watchsection-topic}} or {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-watchsection-subsection}} message in the comment form.
cf-ping-sectionauthor:
Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to add a ping template with the name of the target section author. It is seen when replying to a section.

See also {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-ping-commentauthor}}
cf-ping-commentauthor:
Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to add a ping template with the name of the target comment author. It is seen when replying to a comment.

See also {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-ping-sectionauthor}}
cf-ping-tooltip: Text of the tooltip for the checkbox labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-ping-commentauthor}} or {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-ping-sectionauthor}} message in the comment form.
cf-ping-tooltip-unreg: Text of the tooltip for the checkbox labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-ping-commentauthor}} or {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-ping-sectionauthor}} message in the comment form. Used when the target author is unregistered and the checkbox is disabled.
cf-small: Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to wrap the comment in the <small> tags or a template with a similar purpose.
cf-nosignature: Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to omit the signature.
cf-delete:
Label of the checkbox in the comment form used to delete the comment.

{{identical|Delete}}
cf-block-preview: A noun or noun phrase. See also {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-preview}} (verb or verb phrase).
cf-block-viewchanges: A noun or noun phrase. See also {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-viewchanges}} (verb or verb phrase).
cf-reaction-templateinheadline: Message outputted above the comment form when the user has entered the template code in the headline input.
cf-reaction-signature: Message that appears when the user enters <nowiki>~~~~</nowiki> in the comment input. There will be <nowiki>~~~~</nowiki> instead of $1.
cf-reaction-pre: Message outputted above the comment form when the user has entered <pre>.
cf-notice-editconflict: Message outputted above the comment form while the form is being resubmitted.
cf-error-getpagecode: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-findplace:
Error message outputted above the comment form.

See also {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-error-findplace-unexpectedheading}}.
cf-error-findplace-unexpectedheading:
Error message outputted above the comment form.

See also {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-cf-error-findplace}}.
cf-error-numberedlist: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-delete-repliestocomment: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-delete-repliesinsection: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-preview: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-viewchanges: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-couldntedit: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-pagenotedited: First part of the error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-blocked: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-pagedoesntexist: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-pagedeleted: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-spamblacklist: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-error-titleblacklist: Error message outputted above the comment form. It is displayed when the ''current'' page name is blacklisted.
cf-error-abusefilter: Error message outputted above the comment form.
cf-confirm-delete-yes:
Label of the button in the delete confirmation dialog.

{{identical|Delete}}
cf-confirm-delete-no:
Label of the button in the delete confirmation dialog.

{{identical|Cancel}}
cf-confirm-close-yes:
Label of the button in the close confirmation dialog.

{{identical|Close}}
cf-confirm-close-no:
Label of the button in the close confirmation dialog.

{{identical|Cancel}}
dn-confirm-yes:
Label of the button in the dialog that suggests the user to switch on desktop notifications.

{{identical|Yes}}
dn-confirm-no:
Label of the button in the dialog that suggests the user to switch on desktop notifications.

{{identical|No}}
navpanel-newcomments-count:
First part of the text of the tooltip for the "reload" button in the navigation panel when there are new comments on the page.

$1: the number of new comments.
navpanel-newcomments-outsideofsections:
Heading of the group of new comments that appears in the tooltip for the "reload" button in the navigation panel when there are new comments on the page.

The heading means that the comments are placed outside of sections (i.e. in the lead section).
navpanel-newcomments-toyou: Text that is added in front of the author and date of a comment if it is a reply to the current user's comment. The list of new comments appears in the tooltip for the "reload" button in the navigation panel when there are new comments on the page.
notification-toyou: Text of the notification about a new reply to the user's comment. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}). * $3: the place where the user has replied ({{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-insection}}, {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-onthispage}}, or an empty string is used here). Leave no space after the previous word.
notification-toyou-desktop: Text of the desktop notification about a new reply to the user's comment. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}). * $3: the place where the user has replied ({{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-insection}}, {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-onthispage}}, or an empty string is used here). Leave no space after the previous word. * $4: the page name.
notification-insection: Text of the notification about a new comment in the section that the user watches. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}). * $3: the section name.
notification-insection-desktop: Text of the desktop notification about a new comment in the section that the user watches. * $1: the user name. * $2 (optional): [[mw:Manual:Messages API#GENDER in JavaScript|the user object]], for {{gender:}} use ({{gender:$2|''male text''|''female text''|''text for unspecified''}}). * $3: the section name. * $4: the page name.
notification-newcomments:
Text of the notification about new comments that may be interesting to the user.

* $1: the number of new comments.
* $2: the place where the user has replied ({{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-insection}} or {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-onthispage}} is used here). Leave no space after the previous word.
* $3: sometimes the text of {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-newcomments-maybeinteresting}} appears here. Leave no space after the previous word.
notification-newcomments-desktop:
Text of the desktop notification about new comments that may be interesting to the user.

* $1: the number of new comments.
* $2: the place where the user has replied ({{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-insection}} or {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-part-onthispage}} is used here). Leave no space after the previous word.
* $3: the page name.
* $4: sometimes the text of {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-newcomments-maybeinteresting}} appears here. Leave no space after the previous word.
notification-newcomments-maybeinterestin: Text added to the end of some new comment notifications (see {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-newcomments}}, {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-notification-newcomments-desktop}}). Usually, the line starts: "N new comments in section "Section"...". The rest part may be this message.
sd-reload:
Label of the button in the settings dialog.

{{identical|Reload}}
sd-close-confirm-yes:
Label of the button in the close confirmation dialog when the user tries to close the settings dialog with unsaved changes.

{{identical|Close}}
sd-close-confirm-no:
Label of the button in the close confirmation dialog when the user tries to close the settings dialog with unsaved changes.

{{identical|Cancel}}
sd-removedata-confirm-yes:
Label of the button in the data removal confirmation dialog called from the settings dialog.

{{identical|Yes}}
sd-removedata-confirm-no:
Label of the button in the data removal confirmation dialog called from the settings dialog.

{{identical|No}}
sd-defaultcommentlinktype-radio-link: Label of the item of the radio select labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sd-defaultcommentlinktype}} message in the settings dialog. Regular link means a URL (not a wikilink).
sd-defaultsectionlinktype-radio-link: Label of the item of the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-sd-defaultsectionlinktype}} radio select in the settings dialog. Regular link means a URL (not a wikilink).
ewsd-close-confirm-yes:
Label of the button in the close confirmation dialog when the user tries to close the edit watched sections dialog with unsaved changes.

{{identical|Close}}
ewsd-close-confirm-no:
Label of the button in the close confirmation dialog when the user tries to close the edit watched sections dialog with unsaved changes.

{{identical|Cancel}}
lp-comment: Label of the link pointing to the comment. This link is displayed on log lages such as the watchlist.
lp-comment-tooltip: Tooltip for link labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-lp-comment}} message.
lp-comment-toyou: Text that sometimes appears in parentheses (see {{msg-mw|parentheses}}) at the end of the tooltip for the link labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-lp-comment}} message.
lp-comment-watchedsection: Text that sometimes appears in parentheses (see {{msg-mw|parentheses}}) at the end of the tooltip for the link labeled with the {{msg-wm|Convenient-discussions-lp-comment}} message.
loading-ellipsis: Text displayed in various OOUI process dialogs while their content is loading.
addtopicbutton-tooltip: Tooltip for buttons (interface-standard or not) used to add a topic. Since their main function becomes to open an "Add topic" form provided by Conveneint Discussion, we instruct the user how to create a topic the standard way.
